decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly assemble the Allosaurus Combo by utilizing cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to cheat out Allosaurus Rider, allowing for a powerful combo with Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant or Xenagos, God of Revels. The deck also includes ways to protect the combo with Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer, while also having additional threats like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. Overall, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with its powerful combos and efficient card selection.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells, aiming to win the game as quickly as possible before the opponent can stabilize or set up their strategy. The deck includes a mix of efficient removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Emperor of Bones. The inclusion of cards like Shadowspear and Nihil Spellbomb provide additional utility and disruption options. The deck's synergy with Eldrazi Temple and Prismatic Vista allows for smooth mana acceleration and consistency in casting its spells.

The deck focuses on quickly dropping artifacts to take advantage of affinity mechanics and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. The key strategy involves using cards like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble to ramp up mana and draw cards efficiently, while also utilizing cards like Tormod's Crypt and Engineered Explosives to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Additionally, Sink into Stupor can help control the opponent's hand size, while Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary provide strong creatures to quickly close out the game. The deck also includes a mix of utility cards like Aether Spellbomb and Shadowspear for added versatility.

This deck relies on a fast and aggressive approach, utilizing artifacts to power out threats quickly and overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes synergies between artifacts such as Mox Opal and Urza's Saga to generate mana quickly and deploy threats early in the game. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Metallic Rebuke and Pithing Needle helps to control the opponent's game plan while pushing for damage. The goal is to quickly establish a strong board presence and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly dropping artifacts onto the battlefield to power out explosive plays and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of creatures and spells. By utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to generate mana quickly and efficiently to fuel its aggressive game plan. Through a combination of fast mana generation, card draw, and disruptive spells like Metallic Rebuke, the deck looks to maintain pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. Ultimately, the goal is to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure a fast victory.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game using powerful Eldrazi creatures and Karn, the Great Creator while assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Mine, and Power Plant) to generate a massive amount of mana. This allows for explosive plays and the ability to cast game-changing spells like Ugin, the Eye of the Storms and All Is Dust. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thought-Knot Seer and Dismember to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through a combination of control elements and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponents' spells, removing threats, and drawing cards efficiently. It utilizes a variety of counterspells and board wipes to maintain board control and prevent the opponent from gaining an advantage. Additionally, it includes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils to further disrupt the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of Isochron Scepter provides a versatile and repeatable way to counter spells. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind them down with incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Narset, Parter of Veils. It also includes cards like Orim's Chant and Teferi, Time Raveler to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion adds an additional layer of synergy and value to the deck. The mana base is designed to support the control elements of the deck while also providing the necessary colors for casting spells efficiently.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Griselbrand, and then bringing them back into play instantly with cards like Goryo's Vengeance. Using cards like Faithful Mending and Ephemerate helps to filter through the deck and find key combo pieces. With a mix of reanimation spells, removal, and counterspells, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while quickly assembling its own combo to overwhelm the opponent in a 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance while controlling the board with interaction spells like Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending. A key part of the strategy is recurring creatures with Ephemerate and Solitude, while also drawing cards with Faithful Mending. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its combo potential and powerful creatures, while also disrupting their game plan with removal and counterspells.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive Eldrazi creatures and powerful spells to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer while applying pressure with creatures like Reality Smasher and Eldrazi Linebreaker. The inclusion of cards like All Is Dust and It That Heralds the End provides additional removal and disruption, while cards like Sire of Seven Deaths and Glaring Fleshraker offer finishers to close out the game. The deck's mana base is optimized to support its Eldrazi threats efficiently.

This deck focuses on using ramp cards to quickly get out powerful Eldrazi creatures while also controlling the opponent's board with spells like Kozilek's Return and Malevolent Rumble. The strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats, clear their creatures, and disrupt their game plan with targeted removal. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by quickly establishing a board presence and controlling the pace of the game with powerful spells and creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana quickly using cards such as Pyretic Ritual, Desperate Ritual, and Ruby Medallion. This mana is then used to cast powerful spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Past in Flames to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Manamorphose and Wrenn's Resolve to filter through the deck and find key combo pieces. The goal is to create a fast and explosive combo that overwhelms the opponent before they can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to quickly bring powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield from the graveyard or hand. The aim is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize while setting up a game-winning combo. By utilizing instant reanimation effects and strong card draw options, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and control elements to secure a victory in Modern 1 vs 1 gameplay.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, supported by spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart for removal and reach. The use of Dragon's Rage Channeler and Slickshot Show-Off provides card advantage and pressure, while Mutagenic Growth and Violent Urge can push for extra damage and surprise kills. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for quick deployment of threats. Overall, the deck is built to apply early pressure and maintain tempo throughout the game.

The deck aims to quickly ramp into big creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Griselbrand by using cards like Allosaurus Rider and Neoform to cheat them into play. It also includes a variety of protection spells like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer to keep the combo safe. Planar Genesis and Consign to Memory help with card advantage and mana fixing. The strategy is to assemble the combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures before they can respond effectively.
